system.description:
Cantrips

Starting at 3rd level, you learn the @UUID[Compendium.a5e.a5e-spells.Item.6gfn7uj6tcbatjd5]{Grapevine} and @UUID[Compendium.a5e.a5e-spells.Item.ljixftygfhi0sfsf]{Guidance} cantrips.

Choose an additional cantrip from the following list: @UUID[Compendium.a5e.dnd5e-spells.Item.5ztanmb162mkappn]{Biting Arrow}, @UUID[Compendium.a5e.a5e-spells.Item.bpkked98u8mb2q3w]{Chill Touch}, @UUID[Compendium.a5e.a5e-spells.Item.c1qq11be32b3s1qr]{Fire Bolt}, @UUID[Compendium.a5e.a5e-spells.Item.wb05jikqneh34h1s]{Pestilence}, @UUID[Compendium.a5e.a5e-spells.Item.9ot2c39ypiu4l8ws]{Ray of Frost}, @UUID[Compendium.a5e.a5e-spells.Item.zaeerhaj7ici4dtd]{Shillelagh}, @UUID[Compendium.a5e.a5e-spells.Item.ks87w0iees5tbu0z]{Shocking Grasp}, @UUID[Compendium.a5e.a5e-spells.Item.mqvqffh0lbzzma3a]{True Strike}, @UUID[Compendium.a5e.dnd5e-spells.Item.61c9l425b667za5d]{Uncanny Avoidance}. Those cantrips counts as ranger cantrips for you, and Wisdom is your spellcasting ability for them.

Whenever you gain a level in this class, you can replace the cantrip you learned from this feature's list with another cantrip from the same list.

 

Spell Slots

The Errant Seer Spellcasting table shows how many spell slots you have to cast your ranger spells of 1st level and higher. To cast one of these spells, you must expend a slot of the spell's level or higher. You regain all expended spell slots when you finish a long rest.

 

Spells Known of 1st Level and Higher

You know two 1st-level spells of your choice from the druid spell list.

The Spells Known column of the Errant Seer table shows when you learn more spells. Each of these spells must be of a level for which you have spell slots.

Additionally, when you gain a level in this class, you can choose one of the spells you know and replace it with another spell from the druid spell list, which also must be of a level for which you have spell slots.

 

Spellcasting Ability

Wisdom is your spellcasting ability for your ranger spells, sinceyour magic draws onyour attunement to nature. You use your Wisdom whenever a spell refers to your spellcasting ability. In addition, you use your Wisdom modifier when setting the saving throw DC for a ranger spellyou cast andwhen making an attack roll with one.

Spell save DC = 8 + your proficiency bonus + your Wisdom modifier

Spell attack modifier = your proficiency bonus + your Wisdom modifier

 

Ritual Casting

You can cast a ranger spell as a ritual if that spell has the ritual tag.

 

Spellcasting Focus

You can use a nature focus as a spellcasting focus for your ranger spells.
